title: Sharing Sacred Spaces: Studies in Interfaith Engagement through Sacred Architecture
ci_attrs:
• DI: Area V
  • DI: Non-Christian Religions
description: This course is an opportunity to investigate notions of the sacred and sacred space across religious traditions through both readings and actual interfaith engagement. In the classroom, we engage critically with readings about the nature of the sacred, the “construction” of the sacred, meanings and movement in the built environment, and the intersections between spirituality, culture, and architecture as they manifest in specific world religions. The second aspect of this course is active participation in interfaith dialogue with religious communities throughout the greater New Haven area. Four field trips to local houses of worship provide opportunities to reflect on sacred spaces in an interfaith context and alongside the communities through whom those spaces attain meaning. Area V.
regnotes:
This class requires 4 field trips as follows:
1.Wednesday, October 3rd, 6:00pm-8:30pm:  New Haven Zen Center; 2.Sunday, October 28th, 2pm-4:30pm (approximate):  Congregation Beth-El Keser Israel; 3.November 13th, 6pm-9pm:  St. Mary's Church; 4.Exact time TBD, week of November 28th to December 3rd:  New Haven Islamic Center
